result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Adjourned initial appearance on September 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
1:15 PM Defendant Mindi Marie Bach in court. Alexander Goulart appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court appoints Attorney McCue. Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
A victim in this matter has requested to be notified and present at  all proceedings including the sentencing hearing.

records.addlTxt:
3:26 PM Defendant Mindi Marie Bach appeared by video.  Attorney David Olson for Attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court orders Defendant must sign the bond by August 19, 2022. Matter continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:28 AM Prosecuting attorney David S Olson and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mindi Marie Bach appeared by video. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $1000 set with conditions of no violent or disorderly contact with G.W.F. Defendant to sign bond between July 27, 2022 and July 29, 2022. Defendant to contact Public Defenders Office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
No violent or disorderly contact with G.W.F.
